Thank you so much for your help..I figured out whats going wrong and my mi=
stake i did not added all the jar files in the lib folder to the "CLASSPATH=
" ..when i did added all those jar files to "CLASSPATH" ...the program is w=
orking ..now i am working on how to filter the data that i want from that h=
uge amount of data....

many thanks for your reply ....

kiran


--- In arc=
hive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> Now it's =
not finding the necessary bundled 3rd-party libraries.
> 
> I suggest you u=
se the scripts in the heritrix /bin/ directory as a 
> model; they set up t=
he right classpath for including all necessary 
> bundled libraries. In fac=
t, even the script named 'heritrix' can be used 
> to launch other main cla=
sses (via the CLASS_MAIN environment variable) 
> and in a foreground-mode =
(via the FOREGROUND environment variable), and 
> the 'arcreader' script is=
 an example of doing that with the ARCReader 
> class.
> 
> Separately, it'=
s not the cause of your problems, but the Sun/Oracle JDK 
> is usually the =
safest choice for running Heritrix, at least through 
> JDK6. There have oc=
casionally been obscure behavior/performance issues 
> with OpenJDK (up thr=
ough JDK6, where the code has a somewhat different 
> pedigree and testing =
regime; I think the JDK7 versions are in much 
> closer sync).
> 
> - Gordo=
n
